pageProps.content:
Experience

Set in beautiful gardens, elevated high above Murchison Falls on the north side of the River Nile lies Paraa Safari Lodge.
Guests from around the world visit this area to view the thundering Murchison Falls, a 40-metre high waterfall squeezing through an 8-metre wide gap – a truly remarkable sight!
The lodge’s ideal location on the river allows guests to watch plains game quench their thirst or listen to the hippos grunting in the night.

Stay

There are 54 rooms at Paraa Safari Lodge, each complete with an en-suite bathroom & balcony with breathtaking views of the Nile River.
These rooms are divided between standard rooms, safari tents, suites & one cottage.
The central area of the lodge includes a swimming pool, restaurant with views, gift shop & bar where delicious cocktails are served each day.

Activities

Paraa Safari Lodge offers boat safaris to the majestic Murchison Falls, chimpanzee trekking to the nearby Rabongo Forest, game drives, birding, nature walks, fishing, boat trips to the Delta & hot air balloon safaris – a thrilling way to see Africa’s landscape!

subfolders.title: Baker's Lodge
subfolders.description: Baker’s Lodge enjoys a beautiful location on the southern bank of the mighty Nile River in Murchison National Park – Uganda’s largest national park, & together with adjoining wildlife reserves forms a vast wilderness covering 5,000 square km. The lodge is named after the English explorer, Samuel Baker – the first European to view the falls & name it.

subfolders.description: Nile Safari Camp boasts a beautiful location on the mighty Nile River within Uganda’s Murchison Falls National Park. Guests from around the world visit this area to view the thundering Murchison Falls, a 40-metre high waterfall squeezing through an 8-metre wide gap – a truly remarkable sight!
